newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.

text.p: * Romania has 50 percent chances to join NATO and the European Union, Romania's Foreign Minister Adrian Severin said at a meeting with parliament's foreign affairs commission.
* The funeral of self-styled Gypsy king Ioan Cioaba started in his hometown of Sibiu. Cioaba, 62, died last Sunday of a heart attack in a Bucharest hospital.
Gypsy leaders called for February 26-28 to be considered mourning days for Gypsy communities in Eastern Europe.
Self-proclaimed crown prince Florin, Cioaba's son, will be crowned as "Gypsy King" in September.
